page.title: 09Hailsham Rambling Club
page.content: Organised walks by Hailsham Rambling Club is an area of recreation on Horse-Eye Level. Though only formed in October 1984 it already boasts 80 members, who meet alternate Sundays & Wednesdays. Walks range from 3 - 16 miles & are led by different members. The club walks as many footpaths as possible on the Ordinance Survey Map to keep them open. The countryside is treated with respect & occasionally they find a footpath overgrown, a sign post missing or a bridge broken. A report is made to the Local Authority & then the club arrange a team to carry out the necessary, first telling farmers of their intentions. Members provide own refreshments eaten in a pub, or a barn lent by a farmer or in a hired hall. Subscriptions pay for this & the printing of the quarterly programmes.
